title: B. J. Blazkowicz's relation to Commander Keen.
content:
Besides the fact that id Software created both the Commander Keen and Wolfenstein games, there is a further relationship between the two main characters. The following is an excerpt from the Official Hint Manual for Wolfenstein 3D which explains the relation:

William Joseph Blazkowicz was born August 15, 1911, to Polish immigrants. Blazkowicz was a top spy for the Allied Forces, receiving the Congressional Medal of Honor and other accolades for heroism. "B.J.," (as he was called by his friends) married after World War II, at age 40, to Julia Marie Peterson. Their son, Arthur Kenneth Blazkowicz, became a television talk show personality in Milwaukee. For show biz purposes, Arthur changed his last name to Blaze. Arthur later married Susan Elizabeth McMichaels. They had one son (which they named after Arthur's father), William Joseph Blazkowicz II, or as he signs his grade school homework, B. Blaze....

So...

William Joseph Blazkowicz II is Billy Blazes other name and his parents names are Arthur Kenneth Blazkowicz and Susan Elizabeth McMichaels.


The more you know.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]

title: Re: B. J. Blazkowicz's relation to Commander Keen.
content:
Hah, yeah -- I've heard this before too, but for some reason prefer to use name Billy Blaze. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: But...
content: But if they only had -one- son, why does young Billy "don his brother's football helmet," and why does his sister remind him that he's "got to eat his vegetables?" It's an awesome connection, nonetheless.

title: Re: But...
content:
How about we set an "official" name for his brother and sister, just to make it easier for people? I guess his sister would be Becky (because of Allstories' mod.) Now to come up with one for his brother...

And what about Mort's family? I've always imagined his parents would also have M names, following the pattern of Molly and Mort. I think in all the fanfictions that I never bothered to finish (maybe only a paragraph or two), I named his father Michael. I don't know about his mother, though. I could've sworn I named her something, I just can't remember what.

Um... yeah. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: But...
content:
"But if they only had -one- son ..."
Garg.. I never noticed that that text says "They had one son".. It either just means they have a son (and possibly more kids too) or then iD has just been a bit sloppy -- which I wouldn't wonder, as they had already decided to kill/stop Keen at that point, I guess. I've never really thought this text very official Keeniverse information, and indeed, in case it happens they accidentally have there that the Blazes only have one son, then I won't keep this text worth much.

And yeah, no idea about Mort's family. Michael wouldn't be a bad name..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: But...
content: Maybe this text was written after Billy was born, but before any of his siblings... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

content:
I wonder what name Billy's big bro is... He lent the helmet from his big bro, after all...____________

title: re:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Maybe this text was written after Billy was born, but before any of his siblings... [hr][/quote]

His older brother would have been born before him :P

title: Re: re:
content: That's true, but where does it say his brother is older than him?

title: Emblazoned.
content: That's a good point. Though the fact that the helmet is so large and looks awkward enough on an 8-year-old embodies some potential counter-evidence. For the sake of fitting it in with official literature, though, it could be assumed his brother is somewhat beefy for his age.

content:

title: Re: Emblazoned.
content:
Hmmm.. Crazy! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] I was sure it was mentioned somewhere, but not that sure anymore.. However, I still believe he has an older brother, just because the helmet is so big, and it's how I've always understood it to be. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Not to mention that TMST's popular "10 years on" stuff, as there was his big brother (or sister [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] ).

Speaking of which, it isn't that long anymore till he has to make Keen 20 years on! Awesome! Can you guys imagine that Keen is soon 20 years old? Only three years to go. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

I hope that next 20YO will be done in Flash. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Man, I feel old.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

content:
